summary: Website that displays live global currency exchange rates and allows comparing 2–3 currencies.

existing_features.title: Create a home page that shows live global currency exchange rates in a searchable/sortable table, with a user-selectable base currency (default to USD). Display: currency code, currency name (if available), and the current rate relative to the selected base.

Add a comparison feature that lets users pick either 2 or 3 currencies to compare side-by-side, including: (1) each selected currency’s rate relative to the chosen base currency, and (2) a simple conversion widget where the user enters an amount and sees converted amounts for the other selected currencies.

Implement live rate fetching with automatic refresh using React Query. Use a public exchange-rate REST API endpoint that does not require third-party authentication for basic usage (or provide a single configurable endpoint constant so the data source can be swapped later).

Add a coherent, distinctive visual theme and apply it consistently across the app (layout, typography, spacing, components). Avoid a blue/purple primary palette; use a different primary color direction suitable for a finance/data dashboard.
Add historical exchange-rate charting for a selected currency relative to the currently selected base currency, using the existing Frankfurter API base URL constant (https://api.frankfurter.app).
Implement a date-range control for historical charts with at least these presets: 7D, 1M, 3M, 1Y, and ensure the chart updates when the range changes.

Add a dedicated historical-rates data fetcher and React Query hook (separate from live rates) that caches results by (baseCurrency, targetCurrency, dateRange) and supports manual refresh within the historical view.
Expose an entry point to open historical charts from the existing rates UI (the searchable/sortable rates table), without removing or breaking existing table sorting/search behavior.

Allow users to compare 2 or 3 currencies side-by-side
Add historical exchange-rate charts for each currency
